question: Which type of oral candidiasis does not presents with white patch?
options:
A. Chronic atrophic candidiasis
B. Chronic hyperplastic candidiasis
C. Chronic mucocutaneous candidiasis
D. Pseudomembranous candidiasis

question: A young female presented with vaginal itching and green frothy genital discharge. Strawberry vagina is seen on examination. What w ill be the drug of choice?
options:
A. Doxycycline
B. Oral fluconazole
C. Metronidazole
D. Amoxicillin

question: Which component of cement causes allergic contact dermatitis??
options:
A. Cobalt
B. Nickel
C. Iron
D. Chromium

question: A patient came with history of joint pain and fever for one week. For which the patient took NSAIDS foilowing which he developed rash and hyperpigmentation on nose. What is the most likelv diagnosis?
options:
A. Dengue
B. fixed Drug eruption
C. Chikungunya
D. melasma

question: A 28-year-old patient of neurocysticercosis develops generalized peeling of skin all over except palms and soles staing one month after taking anti-epileptics. What is the most probable diagnosis?
options:
A. Fixed drug eruption
B. Pemphigus
C. Steven Johnson syndrome
D. TEN

question: An 8-year-old boy presents with well defined annular lesion over the buttock with central scarring that is gradually progressive over the last 8 months. The diagnosis is
options:
A. Annular psoriasis
B. Lupus Vulgaris
C. Tinea Corporis
D. Chronic granulomatous disease

question: Postherpetic neuralgia is defined as pain lasting beyond how many weeks?
options:
A. 1 week
B. 2 weeks
C. 3 weeks
D. 4 weeks

question: A 24 years old female presented with patchy hair loss in the right temporal and occipital region. Examination revealed non- scarring alopecia with multiple small broken hairs. Scrapings from scalp showed mild inflammation, peri-follicular hemorrhage and surrounding mild lymphocytic infiltration. What is the most likely diagnosis?
options:
A. Alopecia areata
B. Androgenic alopecia
C. Loose anagen hair
D. Trichotillomania

question: A patient presents with focal alopecia areata. All of the following are associations of alopecia areata except:
options:
A. Nail pitting
B. Atopy
C. Geographic tongue
D. Exclamatory mark

question: Treatment of choice for erythrodermic psoriasis:
options:
A. Methotrexate
B. Coicosteroids
C. Coal tar topical
D. Topical steroids

question: A 45 years old male presents with itchy papules over face, neck and V area of chest for the last three years, which are exacerbated in summers and improved in winters. What test will you do to confirm diagnosis?
options:
A. Patch test
B. Prick test
C. IgE levels
D. Skin biopsy

question: Maculopapular rash is not seen in ?
options:
A. Dengue
B. Rubella
C. measles
D. Zoster

question: A 35 years old male comes with complain of baldness. On examination, well-defined bald patches were seen with no scarring. Small broken hairs were seen in the surrounding area. What is the likely diagnosis?
options:
A. Androgenetic alopecia
B. Alopecia areata
C. Anagen effluvium
D. Telogen Effluvium

question: A child presented with complaint of severe itching over the web of fingers, more at night. Examination revealed burrows. Most probable diagnosis is:September 2009
options:
A. Tinea cruris
B. Scabies
C. Infantile eczema
D. Papular uicaria

question: A man presents it n rashes on face and also complains of decreased mental function. He is also having few macular lesions on his skin. On CT scan, intracranial calcification was seen. His wife is normal. His 10-year old daughter is also normal but his 6-year old son is also having similar skin lesions. What would be the most likely diagnosis?
options:
A. Neurofibrornatosis-1
B. Neurofibromatosis-2
C. Xeroderma pigmentosum
D. Autosomal dominant inheritance

question: A 12 years old boy came with complaints of 4 hypopigmented patches on back and on left arm. The patches had loss of sensation. Which of the following is the treatment for this case?
options:
A. Rifampicin (450 mg) + Dapsone (50 mg) + Clofazimine (150 mg) monthly and 50 mg daily
B. Rifampicin (600 mg) + Dapsone (150 mg) only
C. Rifampicin (450 mg) + Dapsone (50 mg) + Clofazimine (150 mg) monthly and 50 mg alternate days
D. Rifampicin (600 mg) + Dapsone (150 mg) + Clofazimine (300 mg) monthly and 50 mg daily
answer: C. Rifampicin (450 mg) + Dapsone (50 mg) + Clofazimine (150 mg) monthly and 50 mg alternate days

question: After sequential arrangement of blistering disorder staing from superficial to deep blisters, which is the deepest among these?
options:
A. IgA pemphigus
B. EBD
C. PV
D. Bullous pemphigoid+
